title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A, the response must make a defensible claim or thesis that establishes a line of reasoning using one or more of the provided course concepts.

For Task B, the response supports the claim with at least TWO pieces of specific and relevant evidence from one or more course countries. The evidence should be relevant to one or more of the provided course concepts.

For Task C, the response uses reasoning to explain why your evidence supports your claim or thesis, using one or more of the provided course concepts.

For Task D, the response develops an opposing or alternate perspective using refutation, concession, or rebuttal.

For a student to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A. For a student to earn the point for Task D, they must first earn the point for Task A.
